title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
text:
180 g Soft Dates, pitted
200 ml Cream
3 Eggs
1/2 Vanilla Bean(s)
4 tbsp Heaped Cocoa Powder
100 g Flour
1.5 tsp Baking Soda
80 g Butter
Some Butter for greasing the pan

title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
text:
180 g Soft Dates, pitted
200 ml Cream
3 Eggs
1/2 Vanilla Bean(s)
4 tbsp Heaped Cocoa Powder
100 g Flour
1.5 tsp Baking Soda
80 g Butter
Some Butter for greasing the pan

title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
text:
Preparation

Preheat the oven to 170 °C (convection).
Puree dates with cream, vanilla bean seeds, and cocoa powder until smooth.
Then add egg yolks and butter, and blend until the mixture is homogeneous and smooth.
Beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Mix the flour and baking soda into the cocoa mixture.
Gently fold in the beaten egg whites.
Pour the cake batter into any buttered baking pan.
Bake in the preheated oven on the middle rack for approximately 40 minutes.

title: Chocolate Cake for Kids
text:
Notes
The recipe yields 16 pieces and is also suitable for muffin molds. You can enhance the cake with orange zest, ground nuts, nut butter, chili, cinnamon, ginger, cardamom, or cherries. I use soft dates, which are softer than regular dates. If you only have firm dates, soak them in warm water for about 4 hours. I would use a cake pan with a diameter of 18 cm. Source: https://www.chefkoch.de/rezepte/3186881474309297/Feiner-Schokokuchen-ohne-Zuckerzusatz.html

title: Bananabread
text:
125 grams all-purpose flour (unbleached)
125 grams whole wheat or spelt flour
125 grams brown sugar
150 grams small seeds (whatever you like/have: sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, walnut kernels, pine nuts, chia seeds, etc.)
1 good pinch of sea salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
3 medium-sized ripe bananas, peeled
Zest and juice of 1 lemon
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 tablespoons natural or unsweetened soy yogurt or coconut yogurt
2 eggs, preferably organic or free-range, beaten





1 tablespoon tahini
3 tablespoons golden powdered sugar or liquid honey
Juice of 1 lemon

title: Bananabread
text:
125 grams all-purpose flour (unbleached)
125 grams whole wheat or spelt flour
125 grams brown sugar
150 grams small seeds (whatever you like/have: sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, walnut kernels, pine nuts, chia seeds, etc.)
1 good pinch of sea salt
1 teaspoon baking powder
3 medium-sized ripe bananas, peeled
Zest and juice of 1 lemon
2 tablespoons olive oil
2 tablespoons natural or unsweetened soy yogurt or coconut yogurt
2 eggs, preferably organic or free-range, beaten





1 tablespoon tahini
3 tablespoons golden powdered sugar or liquid honey
Juice of 1 lemon

title: Bananabread
text:
Procedure

Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Grease a non-stick loaf pan with butter and dust it with flour (if the loaf pan is not non-stick, you can also line it with parchment paper).
Combine all the dry ingredients in a mixing bowl - flours, sugar, seeds, salt, and baking powder - and mix well.
In another bowl, mash the bananas with a fork (leaving them slightly chunky if desired), then add lemon juice and zest, olive oil, yogurt, and beaten eggs, mixing well.
Add the wet ingredients to the bowl of dry ingredients and gently mix - just enough to combine everything.
Transfer the mixture into the loaf pan and bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Optional: While the cake is baking, prepare the Lemon Drizzle. Stir tahini and powdered sugar in a bowl until smooth, add lemon juice, and mix well.
Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool in the pan until it’s cool enough to transfer to a wire rack. While the cake is still warm, place a large plate under the rack, then poke the cake all over with a skewer, pour the drizzle over it, and let it soak in.

title: Contributing to Our Project
text:
I welcome contributions to this project! Whether you’re fixing bugs, improving documentation, or adding new recipes, your input is greatly appreciated. Please follow the guidelines below to contribute to the project effectively.




To add a new recipe to the repository, please follow these steps:

Navigate to the Recipes Folder: Locate the /recipes subfolder in the project directory.
Create a New Recipe File: Create a new .qmd file within the /recipes subfolder for your recipe. To simplify this process, you can copy an existing recipe file as a template.
Add Your Recipe: Populate the new .qmd file with your recipe details. Make sure to follow the formatting and structure of the existing recipes for consistency.
Commit Your Changes: Once you’ve added your recipe, commit your changes with a meaningful commit message. For example:
git commit -m "Add new recipe for [Recipe Name]"





By contributing to this project, you agree that your contributions will be licensed under its MIT License. Thank you for your contributions! Together, we can make this project even better.

title: Tiramisù
text: Contains raw eggs

title: Tiramisù
text:
Ingredients

4 fresh eggs
100g sugar
500g mascarpone
Savoiardi (Ladyfingers)
Espresso coffee
Cocoa powder

title: Tiramisù
text:
Procedure

Put 4 egg yolks and 50g of sugar together, mix them well so they become a bit foamy.
Add 500g mascarpone and mix to make it homogeneous.
Mix 4 egg whites so they become like snow, towards the end add the other 50g of sugar.
Mix the two mixtures together.
Put a thin layer of the cream on the bottom of the tray.
Dip the savoiardi in coffee (don’t make them too soaked as they will soften slowly and if you put too much coffee they become too liquid).
As you dip the savoiardi, place them in the tray.
Cover everything with the rest of the cream.
Sprinkle cocoa powder on top before serving.




Yummy

title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
text:
200 g Dark Chocolate
125 g Softened Butter
1 Pack Vanilla Sugar
3 Eggs
200 g Brown Sugar
150 g Flour
1 tsp Baking Powder
1 Pinch of Salt
1 tbsp Cocoa Powder





1 Jar Morello Cherries including Cherry Juice (Drained weight approx. 350g)
2 tsp Cornstarch
2 tbsp Powdered Sugar
400 g Cream
250 g Low-Fat Quark
4 tbsp Powdered Sugar

title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
text:
200 g Dark Chocolate
125 g Softened Butter
1 Pack Vanilla Sugar
3 Eggs
200 g Brown Sugar
150 g Flour
1 tsp Baking Powder
1 Pinch of Salt
1 tbsp Cocoa Powder





1 Jar Morello Cherries including Cherry Juice (Drained weight approx. 350g)
2 tsp Cornstarch
2 tbsp Powdered Sugar
400 g Cream
250 g Low-Fat Quark
4 tbsp Powdered Sugar

title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
text:
Preparation

Brownies

Melt dark chocolate with butter in a double boiler. Let it cool briefly.
Mix vanilla sugar, brown sugar, and eggs together.
Add the chocolate-butter mixture and mix.
Mix flour with baking powder, salt, and cocoa powder, and stir into the remaining batter.
Grease a brownie pan (28.5 x 23 cm).
Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius (convection: 160 degrees).
Pour the batter into the pan and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes.
Allow the brownies to cool completely.



Cherry Compote

Drain the Morello cherries over a sieve, collecting 400ml of juice.
Mix about 2 tbsp of the juice with cornstarch and powdered sugar until smooth.
Heat the remaining juice in a pot. Add the starch-juice mixture and bring to a boil until it starts to thicken.
Add the drained cherries and stir well.
Let it cool slightly.



Creamy Quark Cream

Whip the cream until stiff and mix with low-fat quark and powdered sugar.
Spoon 1-2 tablespoons of the cherry mixture onto the brownie pieces in the glass.



Assembly

Take 1 tablespoon of brownies and break it into small pieces.
Place brownie pieces in dessert glasses (approx. 125ml filling capacity).
Pipe a layer of cream onto the cherry mixture in each glass.
Repeat this process for another layer in each dessert glass.
Refrigerate dessert glasses until ready to serve.

title: Black Forest Cherry Dessert
text:
Source
https://www.einfachbacken.de/rezepte/schwarzwaelder-kirsch-dessert-einfach-selber-machen

title: Pancakes
text: Not vegan, contains eggs and milk!

title: Pancakes
text:
Ingredients

250 g flour
2 tablespoons baking powder
500 g milk
2 or 3 eggs
A bit of butter

title: Pancakes
text:
Preparation

Mix the flour and the baking powder
Slowly add the milk and mix
Add the eggs and mix
Add a bit of butter to a large pan and heat
Make the pancakes
